content: And whoever relies upon Allah - then He is sufficient for him. Indeed, Allah will accomplish His purpose. Indeed Allah has set a measure for all things.
The believer is not one who eats his fill while his neighbor goes hungry.
And give good tidings to those who believe and do righteous deeds that they will have gardens beneath which rivers flow.
Every struggle you face is Allah preparing you for something greater. Trust the process of purification.
Allah loves, when one of you does a job, that he does it with excellence.
So remember Me; I will remember you. And be grateful to Me and do not deny Me.
The nafs is like a wild horse - it needs training, patience, and consistent guidance to become your ally.
And whoever fears Allah - He will make for him a way out. And will provide for him from where he does not expect.
Brother Malik overcame his 8-year struggle by replacing every urge with 5 minutes of dhikr. Now he's 200+ days clean and mentoring others.
Whoever conceals the faults of a Muslim, Allah will conceal his faults in this world and the Hereafter.
Indeed, with hardship comes ease. Indeed, with hardship comes ease.
Your past does not define your future. Every moment is a chance for tawbah and a fresh start with Allah.
The strongest jihad is the one against your own nafs. Every victory here is worth more than conquering cities.
And whoever does an atom's weight of good will see it. And whoever does an atom's weight of evil will see it.
Sister Aisha found strength through daily Fajr prayer and partner accountability. She's now helping other sisters on their journey to purity.
